children: A 44-year-old man is diagnosed with COPD.
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

The most likely diagnosis is α1-antitrypsin deficiency. α1-Antitrypsin deficiency should be considered in all patients with COPD, especially those who are younger than age 45 years; have a strong family history of COPD; have no identifiable COPD risk factors; or a have pattern of basilar emphysema. This posteroanterior chest radiograph shows absence of lung markings in the lower lobes consistent with basilar emphysema and the diagnosis of α1-antitrypsin deficiency.
